data: For practice guidelines, refer to Decision Support Tool (DST): Drug Reaction - Minor (diphenhydraMINE)

Exceptions / Contraindications: 
 - Platelet count less than 50,000 for intramuscular routes
-  Hypersensitivity to Diphenhydramine, acute asthma attack or lower respiratory tract disease
For hypersensitivity reactions follow:  BCCA Hypersensitivity to Chemotherapeutic Drug Reaction Protocol
For CT contrast reaction follow: Patient care management procedure established at each BCCA cancer centre. BCCA IV Contrast Learning Module
50 mg, PO, q30 min, order duration: 2 doses/times, drug form: cap, first dose: NOW
50 mg, IM, q30min, order duration: 2 doses/times, drug form: inj, first dose: NOW
50 mg, IV, q30min, order duration: 2 doses/times, drug form: inj, first dose: NOW
Notify treating provider of reaction and ongoing therapy
